*** Bug 39972 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 39611 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 49852 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This problem lies in the AbstractBuildScriptGenerator#setFragments() method. 
This method, which attach fragment to plugins, does not check if the plugin of 
the fragment to be attached exist or not, and therefore generate an NPE.

This is easily reproduceable. In a runtime workbench, uncheck the resource 
plugin from the target platform, and then try to export a feature.

An easy fix consists in modifying the setFragments method to do the check. 
This will solve most of the cases, however if we are trying to build a fragment 
that does not have its plugin we will fail.
In my opinion, this last case is unlikely to happen, and we should still put 
the "simple" fix in for 2.1.3 because it can cause grief later.

Reviewed fix with Pascal and released to r2.1 maintenance branch.

Pascal please double-check and then close this bug report.
*** Bug 41829 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 53168 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Tested that the following steps fail in 2.1.2 and pass in m0225 (2.1.3 candidate
build)

- create plug-in project a
- create plug-in project x
- create fragment project xfrag which requires x
- close project x
- create build.xml for project a

Fails in 2.1.2 with NPE.
Passes in 2.1.3 candidate.
